bibl.title: The Change of Religious Subjects in Graeco-Roman Coroplastic Art.
Alessandria e il mondo ellenistico-romano. I Centenario del Museo Greco-Romano. Alessandria, 23-27 Novembre 1992. Atti del II Congresso Internazionale Italo-Egiziano
bibl.note: In the second half of the 3rd and the early 2nd century B.C., the terracottas produced in Egypt are part of a fertility cult. The types introduced in the 1st century A.D. are representatives of a saviour religion, revealed in mysteries.
